thoughts.speak:
"@type": "Thing", ... } is a valid response.

Example of how to use this endpoint:
```json
GET /things/123 HTTP/1.1
Host: example.com
Accept: application/vnd+openactive+activity-response
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8
{
   "@context": "<http://schema.org/>”,
   "@type": “Person”,
   “name” : “John Doe”,
   “email” : “johndoe@example.com”,
   “sameAs” : [“https://www.linkedin.com/in/john-doe-5964a7bb4b2cad3629fef5964a7bb4b2cad3629fef5964a7bb4b2caud”...]
}
thoughts.text: I encountered an issue with our application, and I need assistance. I've created a ticket for it. Here's the URL to the ticket: https://api.github.com/repos/jmikedupont2/ai-ticket/issues/9. My next action is to poll that URL for updates.
